field2: Biology, Mathematics and Statistics, Physics and Physical Sciences
field: Biology, Mathematics and Statistics, Physics and Physical Sciences
description:
The candidate will study and develop mathematical models in epidemiology, focusing on the fundamental concepts of infectious disease transmission and prevalence within host populations.
 
 The work will begin with the basic Susceptible–Infected–Recovered (SIR) model and then progress to more complex frameworks, including vector-borne transmission and multi-host or multi-pathogen systems.
 
 The student will learn how to determine the equilibrium points of these dynamical systems and analyze their stability. Additionally, the basic reproduction number (R0) of each disease model will be derived and interpreted.
 
 Finally, the student will verify and validate the analytical results through numerical simulations, ensuring consistency between theoretical and computational findings.
 
 Skills that will be developed: Mathematical Model Analysis, Julia Language (coding), Data Analysis.
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Basic Calculus and Programming

description: The candidate should work on image labeling and programming computer vision algorithms for object identification and classification in embedded systems. Basic knowledge of Python and programming logic fundamentals is desirable. Experience in image processing, optimization of algorithms for low-power hardware such as Raspberry Pi or Jetson Nano, and use of libraries such as OpenCV, TensorFlow or PyTorch for machine vision applied to real-time image classification is an asset.
additional_Info: Students from Americas and Europe don't need to issue a visa if their stay is shorter than 180 days
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Embedded Systems and Machine Vision

field2: Agriculture, Biotechnology, Chemistry and Chemical Engineering, Food Science
field: Agriculture, Biotechnology, Chemistry and Chemical Engineering, Food Science
description:
The Research Group in Innovation and Development of Specialty Coffee, aims to conduct research across two lines: the transformation of specialty coffees and the governance and sustainability of the coffee ecosystem. We are seeking students in Chemical Engineering, Food Engineering, Biotechnology, Agricultural Engineering, and Agro-Industrial Engineering, who are interested in understanding how post-harvest processes affect coffee quality. Specialty Coffee refers to coffee that is graded 80 points or higher, on a 100 point scale, which has been certified by a licensed Specialty Coffee Association (SCA) Q Grader (CQI). At the RoastLab, Univalle https://sigelab.net/laboratorio/ElKStj7fl51OmQ6bvi5o , physical and chemical tests are conducted on Arabica coffee beans grown in the Colombian Coffee Cultural Landscape area. The purpose is to identify the potential for specialty coffee that can be valued by coffee consumers worldwide. These results are then transferred to producers to help standardize the processes that enable them to obtain better coffee and become more competitive in global markets.
 The student will develop the following tasks: Physical characterization of green (fresh), dried, and roasted coffee beans. Chemical characterization of green, dried, and roasted coffee beans. Experimentation in the lab and on the farm (in the field, at the productive unit, to obtain a specialty coffee). Participation in the results transfer processes with producers and the academic community. Support in the analysis of relocation agendas and the production agenda for the region (Valle del Cauca) with sustainable development criteria. ​​Participation in academic meetings, seminars, and research debates.
additional_Info: Americas and Europe students don´t need to issue a visa if their stay is shorter than 180 days.
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Data Analytics, Analysis Reporting, is a plus if has intrest in Coffee studies.

description:
We are one of Switzerland's leading architectural/general planning practices and committed to convincing architecture in harmony with economic and sustainable goals. Our international team in Zurich is looking for a highly motivated individual who wants to gain experience in the design and implementation of architectural projects. The tasks include the design of architectural projects in all planning phases in both small and large project teams. A high degree of independence and self-drive are required for this internship.
 
 You will learn about:
 - Drawing in AutoCAD and/or Revit
 - Building of models
 - Design and visualization
 - Presentation and documentation
 - Planning and project organization
 
 We offer:
 - exciting architectural projects in various scales and complexities 
 - an instructive internship in all disciplines of architecture 
 - projects in all business areas (residential, services, laboratory construction, hospital construction, industrial construction, urban development, etc.) 
 - state-of-the-art planning technologies 
 - a mixed and well-positioned team of around 40 committed employees in our Zurich office 
 - flexibility in compatibility with work (annual working hours)
other_requirements: Nomination documents + portfolio should NOT EXCEED 12 MB TOGETHER.
additional_Info: Any student with Non-EU/EFTA nationality needs an official letter from their university, confirming that the internship is compulsory (required for visa/work permit).

Not yet finished Master, and first practical experience in architecture office.
 Knowledge in AutoCAD; Revit and BIM/VDC experience is an advantage.

description: The Engineering and Renewable Energy Engineering internship is a research-oriented experience that builds a broad understanding of clean-energy technologies and their role in achieving a low-carbon, healthy environment. Interns review academic and industry literature; compare renewable options such as solar, wind, storage, and efficiency across buildings, industry, agriculture, transport, and water; study fundamentals of energy systems, grid integration, and decarbonization pathways; and synthesize policy, market, and environmental considerations. The focus is on systems thinking, sustainability ethics, and clear communication. Typical outputs include brief summaries, concept notes, and presentations that highlight opportunities, risks, and high-level recommendations for expanding the use of renewables to support a cleaner environment.

1. Introduction
 This internship offers students the opportunity to gain practical experience in automotive safety, vehicle inspection, and maintenance in Accra, Ghana’s bustling capital. Interns will work with a professional team performing essential inspections, ensuring compliance with road safety standards, and supporting repair operations. Accra provides a vibrant cultural and professional environment, combining urban infrastructure with coastal leisure and a welcoming community.

 - Issuance of Roadworthy Certificates: Supporting the process of certifying vehicles that meet safety standards.

 This role provides hands-on exposure to automotive safety protocols, diagnostic techniques, and practical maintenance workflows, preparing interns for careers in automotive engineering, vehicle safety, or technical inspection.

1. Introduction
 This internship offers hands-on experience in a clinical laboratory environment. Interns will gain exposure to a wide range of biological testing techniques while working alongside experienced health professionals. Kumasi provides a dynamic cultural and professional environment, combining academic excellence, modern lab facilities, and vibrant local culture.
 
 2. Work Description
 Interns will participate in laboratory processes across multiple specialized areas, including parasitology, bacteriology, microbiology, immunology, molecular biology, haematology, and sonography. Key responsibilities include:
 - Assisting in the analysis of clinical samples and contributing to testing procedures in specialized areas.
 - Supporting data recording and documentation of experimental results and laboratory procedures.
 - Assisting in the maintenance of laboratory equipment and adherence to quality control protocols.
 - Contributing to ongoing research projects and staying updated on advancements in biological sciences.
 - Enhancing practical laboratory techniques and technical competencies relevant to each discipline.
 
 This internship provides hands-on exposure to modern clinical laboratory operations and research practices. Opportunity to work in a state-of-the-art laboratory environment in Kumasi.

description:
Physics-Informed Deep Learning for Battery Health and Lifetime Prediction
 
 Overview:
 This project focuses on developing a physics-informed deep learning framework to predict the Remaining Useful Life (RUL) and State-of-Health (SOH) of lithium-ion batteries in electric vehicles. By combining data-driven sequence models with embedded electrochemical constraints, the framework aims to deliver accurate, robust, and interpretable predictions under real-world conditions such as variable driving patterns, ambient temperatures, and fast-charging events.
 
 Objectives:
 1) Curate and preprocess multi-source time-series battery data.
 2) Explore feature engineering methods such as incremental capacity analysis.
 3) Implement and compare LSTM/GRU, transformer-based, and physics-informed architectures.
 4) Design loss functions that balance prediction accuracy with physical plausibility.
 
 Outcomes:
 1) A reproducible deep learning framework for RUL and SOH prediction.
 2) Benchmarked performance across multiple modeling approaches.
 3) Insights into hybrid physics-informed architectures for battery health.
 
 Responsibilities:
 1) Build and preprocess datasets for modeling and training.
 2) Implement deep learning models in PyTorch/TensorFlow.
 3) Evaluate performance under diverse driving and charging scenarios.
 4) Document findings in reports, notebooks, and presentation materials.
other_requirements: The intern should have knowledge related to supervised learning, RNNs/CNNs, and basics of transformer architectures. Familiarity with Python (PyTorch/TensorFlow), time-series data processing, and fundamental battery concepts (SOC, SOH, charge/discharge cycles) is preferred.
additional_Info:
1. The option to work from home is available for this offer. In this case, the available dates for the internship are from May 2026 - September 2026 and there will be no stipend provided.
 However, if the intern chooses to work at the employer's location, a stipend will be provided based on the dates specified in the 'Work Offered Field'.
 2. The intern is required to fill out the attached declaration form to confirm their preferred mode of internship.
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Programming, Machine Learning, Electrical Engineering

employer: Faculty of Information Security and Digital Forensics
description:
Machine Learning, Robotic Process Automation & Computer Network Security Project
 
 Overview:
 This multidisciplinary project integrated Machine Learning (ML), Robotic Process Automation (RPA), and Computer Network Security to design, develop, and evaluate intelligent, secure, and efficient digital solutions. The ML segment focused on predictive modeling using supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning with algorithms such as Decision Trees, Random Forests, and Neural Networks. RPA leveraged tools like UiPath and Automation Anywhere to automate repetitive tasks with cognitive features enabled by ML models. The security component implemented firewalls, intrusion detection systems, encryption, and vulnerability assessments to mitigate threats like malware, denial-of-service, and ransomware. Industry-standard tools, including Python, TensorFlow, and Kali Linux, were used extensively.
 
 Objectives:
 1) Develop predictive ML models with robust evaluation.
 2) Design automated RPA workflows integrated with ML.
 3) Implement and test network security protocols.
 
 Outcomes:
 1) Improved operational efficiency and reduced manual effort.
 2) Enhanced decision-making through ML-powered insights.
 3) Strengthened systems against cyberattacks.
 
 Intern’s Responsibilities:
 1) Build, train, and evaluate ML models.
 2) Create, test, and optimize RPA workflows.
 3) Configure security tools, conduct VAPT, and document findings.
other_requirements: The intern should have basic understanding of machine learning, robotic process automation, and computer network security.
additional_Info: This offer is from the Department of Digital Sciences, and the intern's field of research would be Machine Learning, Robotic Process Automation, and Computer Network Security.
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Python, Network security, Robotics

description:
Project Title: Machine Learning Approaches for Accurate Land Use and Land Cover Classification from Remote Sensing Data.
 
 Land Use and Land Cover (LULC) mapping plays a vital role in urban planning, agriculture monitoring, deforestation studies, and climate change research. Traditionally, LULC classification relies on manual interpretation or conventional statistical techniques, which are often time-consuming and less accurate in handling large-scale remote sensing datasets.
 Machine Learning (ML) provides efficient and automated approaches to analyze satellite images (e.g., Sentinel-2, Landsat-8) for precise classification of land categories such as agriculture, water bodies, forests, and built-up areas. This project aims to apply ML techniques to classify LULC from remote sensing imagery, evaluate their accuracy, and recommend the best-performing models." "Preprocessed satellite dataset for ROI.
 
 Trained ML models for LULC classification.
 LULC thematic maps showing classified categories.
 Accuracy analysis report comparing multiple ML models.
 Workflow documentation for scalable LULC monitoring projects.
 
 This project proposes the use of machine learning for efficient LULC classification, enabling accurate and scalable mapping of land categories from satellite data. The workflow developed can support applications in agriculture, urban planning, and environmental monitoring. The project is achievable within a 6–8 week internship and will provide hands-on exposure to both remote sensing and machine learning techniques.
other_requirements:
Specialization: Machine learning
 Study Level: Graduate
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Python (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)

description:
Computer Science Intern
 Title of the Project: Customization and Flexibility of RPA Solutions
 
 This project focuses on developing flexible and customizable Robotic Process Automation (RPA) frameworks to address the limitations of off-the-shelf RPA solutions, which may not fully meet the unique needs of organizations. The goal is to create adaptable automation tools that can be tailored to diverse business processes, enhancing efficiency and reducing manual intervention.
 
 The intern will work on designing, implementing, and testing RPA workflows, integrating customization features such as dynamic input handling, modular task execution, and process-specific adaptations. The project combines software development, process analysis, and automation strategy to deliver scalable and robust RPA frameworks.
 
 Expected Outcomes:
 
 Practical experience in RPA development and customization.
 
 A flexible RPA framework that can be adapted to multiple organizational processes.
 
 Documentation and presentation of results demonstrating improved automation efficiency and flexibility.
other_requirements: No
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Robotics,Software Development Frameworks

description:
Computer Applications Intern
 Title of the Project: Medical Data Analysis
 
 This project focuses on modeling sequential clinical events to analyze the progression of patient data, including lab tests, medications, and interventions. By examining temporal relationships between events, it aims to uncover hidden pathways of disease evolution, such as progression from mild infection to sepsis and organ failure.
 
 Hands-on work involves implementing techniques like recurrent neural networks, temporal point processes, and transformer-based models to capture complex dependencies in clinical data. These models provide predictive insights that enable timely interventions, personalized treatment strategies, and improved understanding of disease mechanisms in critical care.
 
 The project integrates computational modeling with clinical research, offering practical experience in data analysis, machine learning, and healthcare applications.
 
 Expected Outcomes:
 
 Research publication detailing methodology and findings.
 
 Practical exposure to sequential data modeling and advanced ML techniques.
 
 Presentation of results highlighting the impact of predictive analytics on patient care.
other_requirements: Python or R
requiredknowledgeandexperiences:
Data Analysis,
 Machine Learning,Python

description:
Materials Science Intern
 Project Title: Development of Polymeric and Metallic Composite-Based Electrodeposited Coating and Its Characterization
 
 Project Overview:
 This project focuses on developing polymer-reinforced metallic coatings using electrodeposition and electrophoretic deposition techniques to prevent corrosion, which occurs when metals react with oxygen and water, forming oxides that degrade structural integrity. Such degradation can lead to structural failure and economic losses. The coatings will be designed for applications in aeronautical, automotive, marine, electrical, and mechanical industries, providing durable and protective surfaces. The project will evaluate coating performance using methods like electrochemical impedance spectroscopy, potentiodynamic polarization, hardness testing, tribology analysis, adhesion studies, and surface imaging. By combining metallic and polymeric components, the study aims to enhance corrosion resistance, mechanical strength, and surface durability, contributing to the development of long-lasting and cost-effective protective coatings for industrial applications.
 
 Expected Outcome:
 • Fabrication of polymer-metal composite coatings through electrodeposition and EPD.
 • Performance evaluation using electrochemical and mechanical tests.
 • Analytical report detailing coating characteristics and effectiveness.
 • Presentation summarizing results, surface analyses, and industrial applicability.
other_requirements: Chemistry Lab knowledge
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Handling Electrochemical Instrument, Polymer Synthesis, Good experimental hand, Teamwork.

1- Assembly training on field
 • Identification of each component and its accessories
 • Understanding the functionality of each component
 • Understanding the wiring method of each component
 • Understanding cabinet’s structure and assembly method
 • Hands on assembly training 
 
 2- Introduction to design tools
 • Cad tools 
 o Autocad, Solid works
 o Eplan
 • Programming tools 
 o Siemens WinCC Flexible
 o Siemens Simatic Step 7
 o Siemens Drive Monitor
 o Programming exercises
 § Sequential programming
 § Latching functions
 § Single push button turns on lamp after 1st push then turns off lamp after 2nd push
 • Selection tools 
 o Siemens CA01 Catalog
 o Siemens Sizer
 o Overview on al catalogs used in designs 
 
 3- Brief introduction to the design concept 
 The trainee is to design a sample project in the same design steps followed by an electrical design engineer in a machine design process:
 a- Product Concept & General Electrical Layout
 b- Definition and Sizing of Actuators and Sensors
 c- Definition and Sizing of Machining and Automation Components
 d- Preparation of Electrical Lay-Out Drawings
 e- Preparation of Preliminary Wiring Diagrams
 f- BOM preparation
 g- Design and Development of machining and Automation Software Programs
 h- Design and Development of Drive Parameterization
 i- Preparation of operation instruction manual.
 
 4- Hands on automation and motion control products 
 a- S7-300 / S7-400
 b- Profibus network
 c- Remote IO
 d- Operator panel
 e- Micromaster
 f- Masterdrive Vector control
 g- Implementation of program with hands on training on Lab kit
 
 5- Typical project 
 a- Wiring diagrams and BOM
 b- WinCC design
 c- Programming PLC
 d- PLC and Screen simulation
 e- Micromaster AC Drives
 f- MasterDrive vector control
 g- Commissioning
 
 6- Report and presentation preparation
 a. A presentation will be required weekly
 b. A final report is required by the end of the training phase
  
 Objectives:
 At the end of this training the trainee should have acquired the basics of:
 • Mechanical and Electrical components (bearings, belts, PLC, Drives, protection elements, etc…)
 • Design tools and supporting documents
 • General Design process
 • Hands on Automation
additional_Info: For accommodation, the dorms will be in Byblos
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Student studying towards an engineering or graphic design degree

The intern will participate in monitoring, detecting, and responding to security incidents while supporting preventive measures to strengthen the overall cybersecurity posture of the organization.
requiredknowledgeandexperiences:

 Network security
 
 Firewalls and intrusion detection systems
 
 Malware types and common attack vectors

employer: Institute of Material Science, Dept. of Numerical Methods in Materials Science - TUL
field2: Bioengineering/Biomedical Engineering, Material Engineering and Sciences, Mechanical Engineering
field: Bioengineering/Biomedical Engineering, Material Engineering and Sciences, Mechanical Engineering
description:
The internship takes place in the Division of Numerical Methods in Material Science and Engineering lab. The main area of the division's activity concerns the use of Numerical Methods in Materials Science, FEM modeling, Computer-Aided Materials Engineering and Design, Lattice Structures, 3D printing (FDM, SLA) technology.
 Depending on the specialisation and the interest of the candidate, the intern will become a member of one of the research teams working on the following topics:
 - numerical models manufactured additively, with different core infill type of the samples,
 - numerical analysis of stress and strains,
 - 3D printing in FDM and SLA technology,
 - manufacture and properties of lightweight composite with mineral filling,
 - improve the mechanical properties of 3D printing polymer materials,
 - use 3D printing (FDM and SLA) technologies to produce biomedical components, challenges at the intersection of engineering and medicine.
 Other activities from the department's research area will be added based on the student's skills and interests.

description:
The candidate will work with semiconductor particle detectors for tracking and timing applications in the ATLAS experiment at CERN. The tasks will include laboratory measurements and analysis of collected data.
 
 The candidate will perform electrical tests of the samples and study charge collection with a laser setup. Data analysis will mostly be carried out with C++ (CERN ROOT framework), and using basic Python and Git tools will also be included.
 
 The work will be done at the Experimental Particle Physics department at JSI.
other_requirements: Only applicants with EU, EEA, or Swiss citizenship are eligible.

employer: King Mongkut's University of Technology North Bangkok (Rayong Campus)
description:
- The trainees will be supervised by the faculty instructors who are specialized in related fields of work. The training topics are based on the trainee's background of knowledge and internal in the topics of mechanical and automotive engineering: machine design and simulation, machine testing, chassis and steering design and simulation, and EV issue.
 
 
 (fields of study needed: Mechanical and Automotive Engineering)
other_requirements: ***- The student, who is familiar with field-related simulation software, is needed. The student with responsibility, who can complete the internship until the end period, is needed.
additional_Info:
**-Visa application – You are required to apply for a visa at your nearest Thai Embassy or Consulate. It is very important to apply as soon as you get you acceptance papers from IAESTE THAILAND the application procedure sometimes takes 8-12 weeks. The type of visa that you must get is Non-immigrant-“ED” only. If you wish to travel to the countries nearby Thailand, make sure that you have the multi-entries visa. We need to be informed about your visa extension at least 2 weeks before its expiration date.
 
 Remarks :
 **-In the past, bringing a significant other person while attending the internship has proven to be unsuccessful. Conflicts in schedules and distractions have in some cases led to a less than productive experience for both the intern and the employer. It is therefore requested that a trainee arrive unaccompanied to get maximum benefit from the time spent in his/her internship.

employer: TT-AS Architecture - Construction Joint Stock Company - Website: http://tt-as.vn/ Hanoi
description:
- T-As Architecture and Construction JSC (https://tt-as.vn/company/) was originated from RACBT (Research and Application Centre of Building Technique – University of Civil Engineering). With over 20 years of experience and more than 100 projects done, TT-Associates is proud to be among the ones who shape the landscape of the future. Designing this world is a truly meaningful thing to do. Now we refresh our brand by combining the TT-Associates and TTA-Partners logos together. 
 - The company is one of the best companies in Architecture in Vietnam. Students will have a great time to experience in terms of Architecture Field in reality.
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 - Participate in practical designing works with other staff in the company
 - Develop creativity and expand ideas about planning projects, deploy drawings of urban planning.
 - Support architects and interior designers: Build 3D perspective, deploy 2D technical documents as a customer design requirement. 
 - Arranging layout images and drawings of projects to present to customers, and investors.
 - Deploy designs as a division of leaders
 - Support senior leaders in operating and managing design work in each project. 
 - Deploy construction drawing.
 - Perspective drawing – build ideas
 - Working time: Monday - Friday: 8 hours/ day, Saturday: 4 hours in the morning
 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Prizes of TTAS:
 - National Architecture Gold Award 2024 – 2025 for Grand Mercure 5 star hotel project
 - TOP TEN Vietnam Architecture Firms voted by BCI.
 - National Architecture Award for Hanoi Stock Exchange project
 - 100 Architects of the Year – UIA 2017
 - Awarded Housing design for N04 Complex building- UDIC complex
 - Awarded the Designer Selection for “ Sofitel Legend Metropole hotel renovation 2015” project.
 - Awarded the first prize in design contests for Vietnam News Agency television center ( VNEWS) – 33 Le Thanh Tong str- Hanoi
 & a lot more here: https://tt-as.vn/award/
other_requirements:
- Willing to take part in extra-curricular activities
 - Porfolio
additional_Info: Hanoi is the capital city of Vietnam, and it is expensive to rent a room here. The company can only support an amount of stipend that isn't sufficient for the interns to pay for the accommodation and the fee of electricity; therefore, students need to bring about 250 USD to cover their living expenses.
